buildingOrderModule.simulator

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • buildingOrderModule.simulator.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulator.java --- A Simulator for simulating the future possibilities of provided actions with a collection of available / free (Unit-) Types and busy / occupied ones.
    Author:
    P H - 05.07.2017

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(java.util.HashSet<ActionType> actionTypes,
                 int initialNodeCount,
                 int initialActionSequenceCount)
        Parameters:
        actionTypes - the Actions that are being considered in the generation of the tree.
        initialNodeCount - the amount of Nodes that are initially being stored in the NodeFactory.
        initialActionSequenceCount - the amount of ActionSequences that are initially being stored in the ActionSequenceFactory.

    • Method Detail

      • simulate

        public java.util.ArrayList<ActionType> simulate(int currentFrameTimeStamp,
                                                int frameStep,
                                                int stepAmount,
                                                int currentMinerals,
                                                int currentGas,
                                                java.util.HashMap<TypeWrapper,java.lang.Integer> typesFree,
                                                java.util.HashMap<TypeWrapper,java.util.List<bwapi.Pair<TypeWrapper,java.lang.Integer>>> typesWorking,
                                                TypeWrapper workerType,
                                                int idleScorePenalty,
                                                int consecutiveActionsBonus,
                                                boolean allowIdle)
        Function for performing a simulation based on available ActionTypes and provided resources (minerals and gas) as well as a record of available and occupied / busy TypeWrappers. This simulation generates a tree with each layer representing an iteration / certain step in the time line with a predefined step size. The number of possible Nodes each Node of the previous layer can produce depends on the number of available ActionTypes as well as the available / free Types since the Actions require a free type of Unit to be able to be executed and therefore taken in consideration. This simulation is quite expensive since it takes various factors like the availability of certain Types and the different permutations of all possible ActionType sequences in consideration to produce the "optimal" result at the end of the simulation. These results may vary since the frame step size and the amount of steps being taken have a huge impact on it.
        Parameters:
        currentFrameTimeStamp - the time stamp in frames at which the simulation starts.
        frameStep - the step in frames the simulation takes in each iteration.
        stepAmount - the amount of steps being taken in total (=> Iteration count).
        currentMinerals - the current amount of available minerals.
        currentGas - the current amount of available gas.
        typesFree - the currently available Types in form of a HashMap: Key = Type, Integer = Amount of free Types.
        typesWorking - the currently occupied Types in form of a HashMap: Key = Type, ArrayList = Pairs of resulting TypeWrappers and the time stamp at which they are finished.
        workerType - the type of worker that is responsible for gathering minerals and gas.
        idleScorePenalty - the score penalty for not taking any Actions in an iteration.
        consecutiveActionsBonus - the score bonus for taking multiple Actions at once.
        allowIdle - true or false depending if the creation of idle Nodes (not taking any Actions) in the tree is allowed or not.
        Returns:
        the best sequence of Actions of the tree with the highest score.

      • extractMaxActionTypeOccurences

        private java.util.HashMap<ActionType,java.lang.Integer> extractMaxActionTypeOccurences()
        Function for extracting the maximum number of times a ActionType may appear in a complete simulation iteration. This means a specific ActionType can not appear more than the specified number of times in a finished ActionType sequence.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing the maximum number of times (Value) a ActionType (Key) may appear. If a value can be added indefinitely the HashMap does contain Integer.MAX_VALUE as stored value.

      • extractActionTypeSequence

        private java.util.ArrayList<ActionType> extractActionTypeSequence(Node node)
        Function for extracting the sequence of ActionTypes from a Node and the path starting at the root towards it.
        Parameters:
        node - the Node to which the ActionType sequence will be extracted.
        Returns:
        the sequence of ActionTypes that were taken along the path to and at the provided Node. The smaller the index, the earlier the Action was taken.

      • extractPathFromRootToNode

        private java.util.List<Node> extractPathFromRootToNode(Node node)
        Function for extracting the path from the root of a / the tree towards a provided Node.
        Parameters:
        node - the target Node to which the path will be generated.
        Returns:
        an List with the root at index 0 and the provided target Node at index List.length - 1.

      • createRoot

        private Node createRoot(int currentMinerals,
                        int currentGas,
                        int currentFrameTimeStamp,
                        java.util.HashMap<TypeWrapper,java.lang.Integer> typesFree,
                        java.util.HashMap<TypeWrapper,java.util.List<bwapi.Pair<TypeWrapper,java.lang.Integer>>> typesWorking)
        Function for generating the root of a tree that the Simulator is going to be using.
        Parameters:
        currentMinerals - the available minerals in the beginning.
        currentGas - the available gas in the beginning.
        currentFrameTimeStamp - the TimeStamp in frames that the root is starting at.
        typesFree - the currently available Types that can perform actions.
        typesWorking - the currently unavailable Types that are busy working / occupied.
        Returns:
        a Node that the Simulator can use as root for a generated tree.

      • generateSimulatedMineralGain

        private int generateSimulatedMineralGain(java.util.HashMap<TypeWrapper,java.lang.Integer> unitsFree,
                                         java.util.HashMap<TypeWrapper,java.util.List<bwapi.Pair<TypeWrapper,java.lang.Integer>>> typesWorking,
                                         TypeWrapper workerType,
                                         int frameStep)
        Function for generating the resource values the working Units are going to produce in the simulated time.
        Parameters:
        unitsFree - the currently available Types.
        typesWorking - the currently unavailable / busy Types.
        workerType - the type that represents the worker in the simulation and therefore gathers resources.
        frameStep - the amount of frames the Simulator takes at one time.
        Returns:
        the amount of minerals the specified worker Units are gathering.

      • tryFreeingFinishedActions

        private void tryFreeingFinishedActions(java.util.Collection<Node> nodes,
                                       int simulatedFrameTimeStamp)
        Function for finishing up and removing ActionTypes from a collection of Nodes. The requirement for removing an ActionType is that the time stamp that specifies the completion time of the specific Action lies in the past.
        Parameters:
        nodes - the Nodes whose ActionTypes are being finished up.
        simulatedFrameTimeStamp - the amount of frames the Simulator skips in one single step.

      • findFinishedSimulatedUnits

        private java.util.ArrayList<bwapi.Pair<TypeWrapper,java.lang.Integer>> findFinishedSimulatedUnits(Node node,
                                                                                                  int simulatedFrameTimeStamp)
        Function for finding and extracting the ActionTypes in a single Node whose completion times lie in the past.
        Parameters:
        node - the Node whose ActionType completion times are being checked.
        simulatedFrameTimeStamp - the amount of frames the Simulator skips in one single step.
        Returns:
        a ArrayList of Pairs. These Pairs contain the finished types and the corresponding time stamps. Latter is required for identification.

        Pair.first = Type that creates something.
        Pair.second = TimeStamp of the thing created.

      • generateIdleNode

        private Node generateIdleNode(Node parentNode,
                              int simulatedMineralGain,
                              int simulatedGasGain,
                              int simulatedFrameTimeStamp,
                              int stepAmount,
                              int iterationCount,
                              int idleScorePenalty)
        Function for generating an Node based on another super node. This Node is nearly an exact copy of the provided one except no ActionTypes are being taken and the mineral and gas counts are increased.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - the Node the one being created is based on.
        simulatedMineralGain - the mineral gain the Node is experiencing in one single iteration step.
        simulatedGasGain - the gas gain the Node is experiencing in one single iteration step.
        simulatedFrameTimeStamp - the iteration step in frames.
        stepAmount - the total amount of iterations.
        iterationCount - the index of the current iteration (starting at 0).
        idleScorePenalty - the penalty for not taking any Actions.
        Returns:
        a new Node based on a provided one with no Actions taken and the simulated values attached.

      • generateNewLayerNode

        private Node generateNewLayerNode(Node parentNode,
                                  int simulatedMineralGain,
                                  int simulatedGasGain,
                                  int simulatedFrameTimeStamp,
                                  int consecutiveActionsBonus,
                                  ActionSequence sequence)
        Function for generating an Node based on another super Node. This function takes a sequence of ActionTypes that represent the Actions being taken in the current iteration as well as the simulated mineral and gas gains that are projected onto the total amount of resources available.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - the Node the one being created is based on.
        simulatedMineralGain - the mineral gain the Node is experiencing in one single iteration step.
        simulatedGasGain - the gas gain the Node is experiencing in one single iteration step.
        simulatedFrameTimeStamp - the iteration step in frames.
        consecutiveActionsBonus - the extra score for taking multiple Actions at once.
        sequence - the sequence of Actions being taken in this case.
        Returns:
        a new Node that stores all important information and is based on a super Node.

      • removeNodesUntilSizeMatches

        private void removeNodesUntilSizeMatches(java.util.TreeSet<Node> nodes)
        Function for removing elements from a provided TreeSet containing Nodes. The elements that are going to be removed are the ones at the end of the TreeSet and therefore the ones with the lowest score. Leaving only the "best" ones behind.
        Parameters:
        nodes - the TreeSet from which Nodes are removed.

      • generateAllPossibleActionTypeSequences

        private java.util.HashSet<ActionSequence> generateAllPossibleActionTypeSequences(Node currentNode,
                                                                                 int simulatedTimeStamp,
                                                                                 int maxSequenceCount)
        Function for generating all possible permutations of ActionTypes a Node can perform. This takes the available mineral and gas counts in consideration as well as the fact that the order of the Actions being taken does not matter ((1, 2) == (2, 1) => {1, 2}).
        Parameters:
        currentNode - the Node whose ActionTypes are the base for the generation of the possible permutations.
        simulatedTimeStamp - the time stamp in frames that simulates a certain moment in the future.
        maxSequenceCount - the maximum number of sequences that this function may generate. Needed for limiting the output and decreasing the complexity.
        Returns:
        a Set of all possible permutations that are the result of the ActionTypes being taken based on the provided Node.

      • extractAllPossibleActionTypes

        private java.util.HashSet<ActionType> extractAllPossibleActionTypes(Node currentNode)
        Function for extracting the ActionTypes that can be executed using a given Node from the set of all possible ActionTypes.
        Parameters:
        currentNode - the Node against whose state all possible ActionTypes are checked.
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing all the ActionTypes that can be used in the simulation for the current provided Node.

      • initActionSequenceTreeSet

        private java.util.TreeSet<ActionSequence> initActionSequenceTreeSet(Node currentNode,
                                                                    int simulatedTimeStamp,
                                                                    java.util.HashSet<ActionType> possibleActionTypes)
        Function for initializing the TreeSet that is going to be used in the simulation. It is based on a Node that represents the current simulated state of the game, a simulated time stamp as well as a HashSet of ActionTypes that can be executed using the state of the previously provided Node. The function generates a ActionSequence for each ActionType and adds it to the TreeSet that is returned later on.
        Parameters:
        currentNode - the Node that is used as base for the ActionSequences being created.
        simulatedTimeStamp - the timeStamp in the simulated future in frames.
        possibleActionTypes - the Set of all ActionTypes that can be executed with the state of the provided Node.
        Returns:
        a TreeSet of ActionSequences that is based on the provided Node and the HashSet of ActionTypes.

      • generateNewActionSequence

        private ActionSequence generateNewActionSequence(Node node,
                                                 ActionType actionType,
                                                 int simulatedTimeStamp)
        Function for generating a ActionSequence based on a provided Node, a generated future time stamp and the ActionType that is being added to the sequence of Actions being taken.
        Parameters:
        node - the Node the ActionSequence is based on.
        actionType - the type of Action that is being added to the already existing sequence of Actions being taken.
        simulatedTimeStamp - the time stamp of a simulated moment in the future that the completion time of the Action being taken is added onto.
        Returns:
        a ActionSequence based on the ActionSequence of a provided Node with the addition of another ActionType.

      • findAllPossibleActionTypeCombinations

        private java.util.HashSet<ActionSequence> findAllPossibleActionTypeCombinations(Node currentNode,
                                                                                int simulatedTimeStamp,
                                                                                java.util.HashSet<ActionType> possibleActionTypes,
                                                                                java.util.TreeSet<ActionSequence> actionSequencesToWorkWith,
                                                                                int maxSequenceCount)
        Function for finding all combinations of ActionTypes that can be performed together from the specified Node until a maximum number of them are found / generated.
        Parameters:
        currentNode - the Node that all ActionSequences are based on.
        simulatedTimeStamp - the timeStamp in the simulated future in frames.
        possibleActionTypes - the Set from which all possible ActionTypes are received. This ensures that only possible Actions are being considered for the addition to any existing ActionSequences.
        actionSequencesToWorkWith - the TreeSet that contains the different permutations of ActionSequences that the function is working with.
        maxSequenceCount - the maximum number of sequences that this function may generate. Needed for limiting the output and decreasing the complexity.
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing at most the maximum number of ActionSequences.

      • tryFinalizingNewActionSequencePermutation

        private boolean tryFinalizingNewActionSequencePermutation(ActionSequence baseActionSequence,
                                                          ActionType additionalActionType,
                                                          Node currentNode,
                                                          int simulatedTimeStamp,
                                                          java.util.TreeSet<ActionSequence> actionSequencesToWorkWith)
        Function for testing if a permutation of ActionTypes already exists in a provided Queue of sequences ((1, 2) == (2, 1) => {1, 2}). Therefore this function takes an already existing ActionSequence as well as another ActionType and combines them. This function also adds the permutation to the Collection of stored ActionSequences for future testing if the permutation was not already existent.
        Parameters:
        baseActionSequence - the ActionSequence that is going to be taken as a base.
        additionalActionType - the ActionType that is going to be added to the provided ActionSequence.
        currentNode - the Node that the Sequence is based on (used for checking free Units as well as mineral and gas counts).
        simulatedTimeStamp - the simulated time stamp of a moment in the future at which the ActionType is being executed.
        actionSequencesToWorkWith - the TreeSet that contains the different permutations of ActionSequences that the function is working with.
        Returns:
        true if the ActionType could not be added and the ActionSequence is final and false if the ActionType could be added to the ActionSequence.

      • extractActionTypeAppearances

        private java.util.HashMap<ActionType,java.lang.Integer> extractActionTypeAppearances(ActionSequence actionSequence)
        Function for counting the appearance of different kinds of ActionTypes in a ActionSequence.
        Parameters:
        actionSequence - the ActionSequence whose ActionTypes are being counted.
        Returns:
        a HashMap with the ActionTypes as keys and their appearance count as values.

      • areActionTypeCountsEqual

        private boolean areActionTypeCountsEqual(java.util.HashMap<ActionType,java.lang.Integer> newTestHashMap,
                                         java.util.HashMap<ActionType,java.lang.Integer> referenceHashMap)
        Function for testing if the amount of ActionTypes in a newly created HashMap are the same as another provided reference HashMap. The reference HashMap can contain more keys than the newly created one can provide.
        Parameters:
        newTestHashMap - the newly created HashMap that will be tested.
        referenceHashMap - the already existing HashMap whose stored values the new ones are being checked against.
        Returns:
        true if a difference was found and the newHashMap provides values the existing one does not have or false, if the values in the new HashMap completely match the stored values in the reference HashMap (reference HashMap might also have more / other values stored!).

      • extendActionSequence

        private void extendActionSequence(ActionSequence receiverActionSequence,
                                  ActionSequence transferActionSequence,
                                  ActionType addedActionType,
                                  int combinedMineralCosts,
                                  int combinedGasCosts,
                                  int simulatedTimeStamp)
        Function for transferring information from one ActionSequence (transferActionSequence) to another new ActionSequence (receiverActionSequence) with the addition of a new ActionType that will be executed together with the already stored ActionTypes in the sequence.
        Parameters:
        receiverActionSequence - the ActionSequence that receives all necessary information.
        transferActionSequence - the ActionSequence that provides all necessary information.
        addedActionType - the ActionType whose requirements will be added towards the occupied types of Units and removed from the free ones.
        combinedMineralCosts - the combined mineral costs of the base ActionTypes in the ActionSequence and the newly added ActionType.
        combinedGasCosts - the combined gas costs of the base ActionTypes in the ActionSequence and the newly added ActionType.
        simulatedTimeStamp - the time stamp at which the simulated ActionType takes place.

      • setActionTypes

        public void setActionTypes(java.util.HashSet<ActionType> actionTypes)
